subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01F3_01CA216A.D4147180
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"I dont worry what anyone else thinks. I have no need to prove anything to =
anyone else. They can do that for themselves."

Thank you!!! That's what I'=
m sayin'.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: bulletbabea 
  To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 2009 8:32 PM
  Subject: [=
EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...


    I think it varies depending on who=
 you ask as well as what they have personally experienced. As an example, s=
ome people believe in angels and demons others do not. Therefor some may ge=
t messages that correspond to their own beliefs as well as the beliefs of t=
hose who are speaking.

  Almost every person who does this eventually deve=
lops a theory that may change over time based on what they experience and w=
hat their beliefs are. Then there are those who remain undecided or have do=
ubts.

  As for me I look at it as purely educational, a learning experienc=
e. Ive met many people I never knew existed. Ive researched topics I'd neve=
r even considered. Ive gotten messages and images that are awe inspiring an=
d many interesting concepts to ponder and explore.

  There are many glimps=
es of truth, as well as momentary proof along the way that lead me to devel=
op my own theory and eventually you will develop your own too. This researc=
h is fascinating and can be quite mind blowing.

  I dont worry what anyone=
 else thinks. I have no need to prove anything to anyone else. They can do =
that for themselves. I always say honesty is the best policy and if you are=
 honest with yourself and others the only ones who object are those who's l=
ies arent tolerated. So just look for the truth yourself and dont let me or=
 anyone else tell you what that is. 

  It's a great journey and your path =
is your own!

  Misty

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "mrscaptainjack2" =
<jjkamp@...> wrote:
  >
  > Thank you, guys, but I just wanted to make sure=
 -- really sure. Sometimes it's hard on here to figure out which post is re=
plying to which!
  > 
  > So I've been thinking about this over and over --=
 I've been able to think of little else in the last few days -- trying to f=
igure this out and make some sort of reasonable theory I can live with. I k=
now we will never have a true answer, at least not any time soon, but surel=
y those who have been doing this for years and years must have a working th=
eory on what these entities are? Based on their behavior rather than what t=
hey say? Based on consistencies from researcher to researcher? Based on thi=
ngs these entities know and don't know (e.g. knew my dad's friend Gordy was=
 dead, while I did not)?
  >
